Egypt's top archaeologist, Zahi Hawass , told state television Egyptians on the street had tried to protect the building, but that the looters had entered from above. Two mummies on display had been damaged. I felt deeply sorry... when I came this morning to the Egyptian Museum and found that some had tried to raid the museum by force last night, Zahi Hawass , chairman of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, said.
